title: What is the most used name in song lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: John or Johnny is often given as the most popular Which Names Appear the Most in Pop Songs? We Have the Data. But …? l have a hunch that that’s only in 20th Century Popular music (it even says it in the link). There is another type of song, hymns, which are sung to deities and here one deity Jesus seems to feature in more hymn titles, and in even more lyrics in the Christian tradition, than any other holy name. As hymns have been written since antiquity, songs about Jesus, have had over 1900 years of a head start on songs about Johns & Johnnys. Wikipedia lists 141 of the most popular hymns were Jesus is used in the lyrics alone Category:Songs about Jesus - Wikipedia. So l’m afraid for “most used name in song” it’s Bye Bye Johnny and roll on Jesus.  Aretha Franklin - What a friend we have in Jesus

Research reveals: What is the most used name in songs? The most common name was Johnny. There have been 46 hit songs with the name John or Johnny, from “Johnny B. Goode” to “Sloop John B” to “Do the John Wall.” And while Johnny reigns supreme, female names have an edge on male names overall, 52 to 48 percent.Jul 29, 2014 Most common names in songs: Why is pop music obsessed with ...
